user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_create:
```c
struct MemoryPool *
MHD_pool_create (size_t max)
{
  struct MemoryPool *pool;
  size_t alloc_size;

  mhd_assert (max > 0);
  alloc_size = 0;
  pool = malloc (sizeof (struct MemoryPool));
  if (NULL == pool)
    return NULL;
#if defined(MAP_ANONYMOUS) || defined(_WIN32)
  if ( (max <= 32 * 1024) ||
       (max < MHD_sys_page_size_ * 4 / 3) )
  {
    pool->memory = MAP_FAILED;
  }
  else
  {
    /* Round up allocation to page granularity. */
    alloc_size = max + MHD_sys_page_size_ - 1;
    alloc_size -= alloc_size % MHD_sys_page_size_;
#if defined(MAP_ANONYMOUS) && ! defined(_WIN32)
    pool->memory = mmap (NULL,
                         alloc_size,
                         PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
                         MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANONYMOUS,
                         -1,
                         0);
#elif defined(_WIN32)
    pool->memory = VirtualAlloc (NULL,
                                 alloc_size,
                                 MEM_COMMIT | MEM_RESERVE,
                                 PAGE_READWRITE);
#endif /* _WIN32 */
  }
#else  /* ! _WIN32 && ! MAP_ANONYMOUS */
  pool->memory = MAP_FAILED;
#endif /* ! _WIN32 && ! MAP_ANONYMOUS */
  if (MAP_FAILED == pool->memory)
  {
    alloc_size = ROUND_TO_ALIGN (max);
    pool->memory = malloc (alloc_size);
    if (NULL == pool->memory)
    {
      free (pool);
      return NULL;
    }
    pool->is_mmap = false;
  }
#if defined(MAP_ANONYMOUS) || defined(_WIN32)
  else
  {
    pool->is_mmap = true;
  }
#endif /* _WIN32 || MAP_ANONYMOUS */
  mhd_assert (0 == (((uintptr_t) pool->memory) % ALIGN_SIZE));
  pool->pos = 0;
  pool->end = alloc_size;
  pool->size = alloc_size;
  mhd_assert (0 < alloc_size);
  _MHD_POISON_MEMORY (pool->memory, pool->size);
  return pool;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_pool_create:
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
#define ROUND_TO_ALIGN(n) (((n)+(ALIGN_SIZE-1))/(ALIGN_SIZE)*(ALIGN_SIZE))
...
#define _MHD_POISON_MEMORY(pointer, size) (void)0
...
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The function MHD_pool_create has a single parameter, 'size_t max'. A review of the function body shows 'max' is only read in expressions and passed to macros/functions (comparisons, arithmetic to compute alloc_size, and ROUND_TO_ALIGN(max)). There is no assignment to 'max' (no statement like 'max = ...'), and no pointer parameter exists whose value (the pointer itself) could be modified. The relevant macros provided (mhd_assert, ROUND_TO_ALIGN, _MHD_POISON_MEMORY) are either no-ops or pure expressions that do not alter their arguments. Calls to malloc/mmap/VirtualAlloc use 'max' only to compute allocation sizes and do not modify the parameter. Therefore there are no code fragments that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 and nothing needs to be flagged for investigation.
